messages.text: hey, are you still coming to dinner with my friends tonight?
I don’t know. I had a long day, kind of not in the mood for small talk.
that’s fine, I just already told them you’d come. they’ve been asking to meet you for weeks.
why do you always make plans without checking with me first?
I didn’t think it was a big deal, it’s just dinner. you usually like going out.
yeah, but lately it feels like you just drag me to these things to make yourself look good.
what? that’s not true. I just want them to know you. they keep asking about you.
you don’t get it. every time we go out, you’re glued to them and I’m just sitting there.
I try to include you, but sometimes you don’t even respond when they ask you stuff.
maybe because the whole thing feels fake. like I’m supposed to smile and pretend everything’s fine.
what do you mean “pretend”? nothing’s wrong, we just haven’t had time together this week.
exactly. you’re too busy with your stuff. you barely even text me during the day anymore.
that’s not fair, I was in meetings all morning. I told you that.
I see you posting on Instagram though.
that was just a story from yesterday. you’re really overthinking this.
maybe I wouldn’t if you actually made me feel like a priority.
Ryan, that’s not fair. you know how much I care about you.
sometimes I wonder. I feel like I’m the only one trying lately.
that’s not true at all. I’ve been trying to plan things, like tonight.
see, that’s what I mean. you think “planning things” fixes everything. it’s not about that.
then what is it about?
it’s about effort. consistency. you saying you care but acting like you don’t.
I can’t always be available every second, I have work too.
yeah, you always have an excuse.
that’s not an excuse, it’s just reality.
whatever. go to your dinner. I’ll just stay home. I don’t want to ruin your perfect night.
that’s not what I want. I wanted you there.
you say that now, but you’ll probably have more fun without me anyway.
please don’t do this again. it feels like every time I try, you find something wrong.
because I actually care, Lena. I notice when you pull away. you just don’t get it.
I do get it. I just wish you trusted me more instead of assuming the worst.
maybe if you acted like you actually wanted me around, I wouldn’t have to.
I can’t keep proving myself every time we disagree.
see? now you’re making me the bad guy again.
I’m not. I just want us to talk without turning everything into a fight.
I’m done talking. goodnight.
…okay. goodnight.
